result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric Tyrone Rucker

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Denying Petitioners for Expungement, signed and filed.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Conen, Br. 30, for review. mag
Filed by Eric Rucker, Letter Requesting Expungment and Supplemental Documentation  (Return Address:  Eric Rucker, 3058 N. 34th Street, Milwaukee, WI  53210).

Defendant Eric Tyrone Rucker in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing.
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to cases 13CM3476 & 15CM480. 
for the purposes of sentencing.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated May 18, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant Eric Tyrone Rucker in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for status conference.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated April 30, 2015 received and filed.

15RM020719  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04/16/2015

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Bayshore Town Center,  Glendale, WI

Defendant Eric Tyrone Rucker in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Eric Tyrone Rucker in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case adjourned for Status Conference May 1, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 37.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
